review: I mean, there's been a lot of soulless cash grabs in the past decade in the gaming scene. OW2 really just takes the cake though. I mean, imagine rehashing the same game from 2016, claiming a PvE mode and skill trees, actual features to make the game a 'sequel', and instead you scrap all of that and release a unbalanced version of the same game from 2016, take away everything that awarded you for playing the game, and locked it all behind $20+ paywalls. Incredible work Blizzard!

Ð”Ð°Ð¶Ðµ Ð¼Ð¾Ð¹ ÐºÐ¾Ñ‚ Ð¿Ð¾Ð½Ð¸Ð¼Ð°ÐµÑ‚ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ð¾ Ð¸Ð³Ñ€Ð° ÑÐºÐ°Ñ‚Ð¸Ð»Ð°ÑÑŒ.

Even my cat understands that the game has slipped.

Overwatch was a good game. As someone who had been playing the game since Symmetra's teleporter was her ultimate, I enjoyed my time with Overwatch. When they announced Overwatch 2, I raised my eyebrows for a second, but immediately was called into the hype by the progression based, cooperative story mode they had promised us. When the original Overwatch shut down, and Overwatch 2 took its place, I looked at the changes made, and I thought they were fine. They didn't have the story mode yet, but I could tell they were rushing it, and had delayed it for a bit. That was fine, I thought. I can wait a bit for new stuff. Then I saw the new monetization system.

I hate battle passes. I'm biased against them. In your face, all over the title screen, taking up the majority of their roadmap, all in your face shouting "GIVE US MONEY GIVE US MONEY GIVE US MONEY OR YOU MISS OUT ON COOL COSMETICS FOREVER!!!", I utterly despise them. And Overwatch 2 was no different. Gone were the loot boxes that yes, you COULD pay for, but you in no way needed to, you got one every now and then as you played the game and racked up arbitrary Experience Points. In its place was the same bullshit Fortnitey Vbuck Robux scam crap that every single game seemed to have nowadays. And new heroes on the battle pass, it spat in the face of its own game design! This sucked, and I sat there disgusted at how blatantly cash grabby it was, but I remembered that story mode that was planned, and I continued to play the game, albeit not as much, because I still had all my skins from Overwatch. I didn't need to pay money, because all the characters I was used to playing were still available to me, with more free characters alongside the battle pass ones.

And then they canceled the story mode. Out of the blue, they just said "Oh yeah, the story mode? We trashed it like, 9 months ago, and didn't tell anyone, we figured the hype would be drowned out by the battle pass, so we kinda forgot." And then they parade around the new "Story Missions", which for all intents and purposes seems like just the broken remnants of the story mode they had planned, stitched together, stuffed with cotton, and sprayed with Febreze to make it harder to smell the rot. And they have the audacity to sell them for FIFTEEN DOLLARS for the FIRST THREE ONLY. No progression, no nothing, just three reanimated corpses of content dancing a sickening waltz on stage that you could shake hands with for fifteen dollars. 

It wasn't a straw breaking a camel's back. The camel was perfectly fine, save for a little bit of disease showing around the gum line. They then took that camel and dropped a boulder on it, shattering it entirely until it became a wailing wreck, begging for death while its owner and the content creators around it continuously milk it for all the money it's worth.

I'd love to say it's a fun game. A fun multiplayer shooter whose story may be in the background, but it's still there for those who want to look deeper. A wide variety of playable characters whose abilities interact with and against each other in different, exciting ways. In fact, I've said that multiple times in the past, whenever it came up in conversation. And that game, that Overwatch I enjoyed for so long, there are still pieces of it in Overwatch 2, but what Activision Blizzard did to it is unforgivable. Shattering the power balance by introducing characters you have to pay extra for, removing the cosmetic progression system that wasn't begging for money, painting over absolutely everything with battle pass this, give our million dollar corporation more money that, all while parading around the corpse of an actually fun game to try to get even more profit, and expecting us to forget what was promised and pay for this hollow, broken shell instead. 

I've had enough. Everybody's had enough. 

Do not play this game. Overwatch is dead. Activision Blizzard killed it. 

And for the few who stay, hoping it will get better, I do too. I miss Overwatch, and I think it's still possible to fix. They'd just need to abandon everything they've done so far and start all over. Again.

Farewell, Overwatch. I enjoyed our time together. I just hope your death is as swift and graceful as it can be.

â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â¢¾â ¿â ‹â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €

The game went from tactics and character choice making the difference between wins and losses and is now just call of duty with skills, dps skill and damage output choose the path of the entire game. No longer fun and no longer viable for anything other than a cash grab.

The basic game principle of mmo playstyle shooter was simply never a good idea.

It's not really a shooter, but has terrible gunplay.
It's not really a rpg, but has a terrible skill system.
The team/class based gameplay/modes are just lousy with all the limitations, rules and balancing. 

Overwatch is a strange mix that tries to be many things but does absolutely nothing right. 

One new game mode in particular "Push" is just beyond stupid.
You can't tell me that anyone who has ever played a single multiplayer game came up with this and thought it was a good idea.

These are all the reasons why the player base keeps plummeting and the reason why it's here now. It's just not fun. 

And that's just the rating of the game. There is so much else that comes up negatively.

The Battle-pass. The cost. The lousy skins. The bad copies of the lousy skins. The absurd prices of the good skins. The predatory skin packages and prices. The new characters locked behind a cruel long grind, while others who have paid already affect teamplay. The cancellation of the pve content. 

No doubt Activision Blizzard will abandon the official league of their game that only survives through online multiplayer as quickly as last time. Don't waste your money

Sombra is on the Enemy Team

my friend, I stand before you with an inferno of indignation burning within me, a righteous fury that demands to be heard.   The actions of this company, once a beacon of promise, have degenerated into a pit of avarice and disregard that beggars belief.   Their arrogance, once hidden beneath a veneer of competence, now stands bare for all to see, a grotesque monument to the erosion of integrity.

Gone are the days of camaraderie and shared passion, replaced by an air of haughtiness that stifles the very essence of what a gaming community should be.   The hollow echoes of their promises reverberate through the void of their actions, as they choose to forsake innovation in favor of pandering to the lowest common denominator.

The audacity to parade a sequel that offers nothing more than a paltry facelift is an offense that breaches the boundaries of respect for their player base.   Like a huckster selling tarnished trinkets, they seek to profit from the goodwill and dedication of those who once believed in their vision.   This audacious display of greed is an assault on the intelligence of their audience, a cynical attempt to extract revenue while offering crumbs of substance.

My anger knows no bounds as I castigate this wanton disregard for artistic integrity and the trust of players.   They have embarked on a path of betrayal, forsaking the devotion of their patrons in favor of short-term gains.   Their actions bespeak an arrogance that befits the decadent despots of history rather than the guardians of a beloved gaming world.

friend, I implore you to stand alongside the incensed chorus of players who demand better.   The time for complacency is past;   the time for accountability has come.   Let our collective anger be the rallying cry that reverberates through the corridors of this company's power, an unequivocal statement that we shall not be silenced, nor shall we accept mediocrity in the face of the promise we once believed in.

The flames of my indignation rage forth, a beacon to those who have similarly felt the sting of betrayal.   Let us demand excellence, let us demand integrity, and let us remind this company that our voices shall not be drowned out by the cacophony of their indifference.

just a empty shell of what overwatch was and is suppose to be. if you like overwatch 1 you can play this, but you will feel like its not the same and not in a good way.
I loved OW1 played it for hundred of hours. but OW2 feels like a cheap "upgrade" that is only suppose to get you to spend money on it even more

From heroes to zeros, Blizzard's trajectory is a typical short-sighted, greedy, capitalistic fall from grace.
It's one thing to evolve a game, but to essentially hijack our initial monetary and time investment by completely removing Overwatch1 and forcing us into Overwatch2 is beyond manipulative, it's a calculated betrayal.

"Heroes never die" was the rallying cry of a game I once loved. But seeing how OW2 and Blizzard are in their death throes, goes to show they were never the "heroes", they just pretended.

Given the trash they've produced, Blizzard, together with its internal garbage they call "execs", should be hung out to dry. 
They've taken a masterpiece and mutilated it for their petty gains, althewhile abusing their own employees, taking the community for fools and thinking we'll just forget if they give us a few shiny things. 

Buying this game is like funding the mafia. Behind closed doors they engage in abhorrent behaviour thinking nobody will find out. Joke's on them, the world found out!

The legacy of Blizzard's harm, highlighted by the death of Kerri Moynihan at the hands of Blizzard's sexual abuse, is their indelible stain. I hope all those involved in the abuse experience 10 times the pain of Kerri. If they were all lined up to be flogged, I'd buy front row tickets and request an encore.

May you burn in hell Blizzard, together with all of your decision makers. You were once great, now you're shit. Piss off and disappear already.
consider taking a shower before review bombing
I would rather play Geometry Dash
Very bad game love comes from America.

A lot of people are acting like they're being forced to play the game and are saying the game's shit because of it. The content creators are also the most clout hungry people I have ever seen so don't listen to them. Or anyone reviewing this for that matter. Form your own opinions. The game's free. You don't need to buy any of the additional content if you don't want to. The story missions were always meant to be a paid thing so buy that if you want. Or don't. Your choice.

horrible game, could be fixed but has so many flaws
in the game: tanks are unbalanced, why play doomfist, a fun and fast character when he dies super fast and does nearly no damage when you can play orisa and get 200 self heal, 5 second invul, and a huge stun?
why play echo when you can just go soujourn and one tap everyone?
why play baptise or zenyatta which are VERY fun classes when you can completely outshine them with kiriko by having better healing, utility, and extremley overpowered attacks?
outside the game the devs are sex offenders, lying cunts, and inconsiderate, free pve with multiple moves on launch? added later for $15 and is completely unfinished, also every single skin is $20, not fortnite where its only one character you ALWAYS play as in every map game and server, that only for one character that can be used by someone else or on the wrong role
